    		The 2022–2023 Season
    	The Wizard of Oz: A Journey to Find That There is No place Like HomeSenior musical theatre student Jessie Grimaldo will play the role of Dorothy Gale in "The Wizard of Oz." (Photo by Matt Bates, University Photographer)As spring rain clouds drift to make way for the bright rays of summer, feelings of nostalgia can be found somewhere over the rainbow in the Chico State Music and Theatre Department's production of "The Wizard of Oz"This evocative show recounts the tale of farm girl Dorothy Gale as she travels over the rainbow from Kansas to the mystical Land of Oz. There, she meets an ensemble of characters including the Scarecrow, Tin Man and the Lion as she discovers that there truly is no place like home.The spring musical opens at Laxson Auditorium on Thursday, May 4, with 7:30 p.m. performances through May 6. There will be a 2 p.m. matinee on Saturday, May 6, and the final performance is at 2 p.m. on Sunday, May 7.The Chico Chapter of the Chico State Alumni Association is hosting a reception following the Sunday matinee. Alumni who wish to attend Alumni Day at Laxson mustregister online at https://tinyurl.com/oz-reception(opens in new window). For more information contact the Alumni Association at 530-898-6472.Read morePurchase ticketsEvents ScheduleSpring 2023 Events  Click the event title for more informationSpring Musical: Wizard of OzMay 4-7Brass Choir Concert: Brass from the Past!May 9College of Humanities & Fine Arts (HFA)Arts & Humanities Building Room 279 Zip 0800530-898-5351hfa@csuchico.eduwww.csuchico.edu/hfaSupport Our CollegeProgram PortfolioHFA Majors & ProgramsArt & Art HistoryComparative Religion & HumanitiesEnglishHistoryLanguages & CulturesMusic & TheatrePhilosophy
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
